title: Crispy Parmesan Chicken with Couscous
directions: Adjust rack to middle position and preheat oven to 425 degrees.
Bring a medium pot of salted water to a boil.
Trim, peel, and halve carrots. Cut crosswise into 2" pieces.
Trim and thinly slice scallions, separating whites from greesn.
In a small bowl, combine panko, Parmesan, paprika, a large drizzle of olive oil, and a pinch of salt and pepper.
pat the chicken dry with paper towels. Season all over with salt and pepper. Place on one side of a baking sheet.
Spread the tops of the chicken with sour cream. Mound with the panko mixture, pressing to adhere.
Toss the carrots on the opposite side of the baking sheet with a large drizzle of olive oil, salt, and pepper. Roast on middle rack until chicken is cook through, 15 - 20 minutes.
Meanwhile, add couscous to the pot of boiling water. Cook until tender, 6 - 8 minutes.
Melt the garlic herb butter in the empty pot over medium heat. Add scallion whites and cook until softened, 30 - 60 seconds.
Return couscous to pot and stir until coated. Taste and season with salt and pepper.
Once carrots are done roaste, remove from oven and toss with lemon zest and a large sqeeze of lemon juice.
Divide chicken, carrots, and couscous between plates. Garnish chicken with scallion greens. Serve with remaining lemon wedges on the side.
